title: Open Source Readiness
description:
Prepare SpecLedger project for open source release by establishing legal compliance, documentation, contributor onboarding, release automation, and community infrastructure.

This feature adds:
- Legal files: NOTICE, GOVERNANCE.md
- CI/CD quality workflow with golangci-lint
- README badges (build, coverage, license, version)
- Documentation structure for specledger.io/docs
- Codecov integration for coverage tracking

Project is 90%+ ready with existing LICENSE, CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md, SECURITY.md, CONTRIBUTING.md, GoReleaser, and Homebrew tap.

title: Phase 1: Setup and Infrastructure
description:
Shared infrastructure setup for all open source readiness work.

Creates:
- golangci-lint configuration (.golangci.yml)
- CI quality workflow (.github/workflows/ci.yml)
- Go version update (1.21 → 1.24)
- Codecov setup

These tasks block all user stories as they establish the quality infrastructure.

title: Add golangci-lint configuration
description:
Create .golangci.yml configuration file with standard Go linters (gofmt, govet, staticcheck, errcheck, gosimple, ineffassign, unused, gosec).

WHY: Establish consistent code quality standards across the project.

WHAT: Create .golangci.yml at repository root with enabled linters and appropriate settings.
design:
Use standard golangci-lint configuration:
- Enable: gofmt, govet, staticcheck, errcheck, gosimple, ineffassign, unused, gosec
- govet: check-shadowing: true
- gofmt: simplify: true
- run: timeout: 5m, tests: true

Reference: .specledger/templates/plan-template.md for standards
acceptance_criteria:
- .golangci.yml exists at repository root
- Contains all 8 required linters
- 'golangci-lint run' executes without errors
- Configuration matches quickstart.md specification

title: Create CI quality workflow
description:
Create .github/workflows/ci.yml for continuous integration with test, lint, and format jobs.

WHY: Provide automated feedback to contributors within 5 minutes and ensure code quality.

WHAT: Create CI workflow with test, lint, and format checks using GitHub Actions.
design:
Create .github/workflows/ci.yml with three jobs:
1. test: go test, coverage upload to Codecov
2. lint: golangci-lint with latest version
3. format: gofmt check

Use Go 1.24 (upgraded from 1.21). Use actions/checkout@v4, actions/setup-go@v5, codecov/codecov-action@v4, golangci/golangci-lint-action@v6.

Reference: quickstart.md Step 3, contracts/ci-cd-contract.md
acceptance_criteria:
- .github/workflows/ci.yml exists and is valid YAML
- Workflow runs on push to main and pull requests
- All three jobs (test, lint, format) pass on main branch
- Go version set to 1.24
- Coverage uploads to Codecov successfully

title: Add README badges
description:
Add status badges to README.md for build status, coverage, license, and version.

WHY: Provide quick visibility into project health and status for users and contributors.

WHAT: Add 5 markdown badges at the top of README.md.
design: Reference: research.md README Badges section, quickstart.md Step 5, spec.md FR-012
acceptance_criteria:
- All 5 badges present at top of README.md
- All badges link to correct destinations
- Build badge reflects CI workflow status
- License badge shows MIT
- Version badge shows latest release

title: Phase 2: US1 - License Compliance
description:
Open Source License Compliance (P1)

Ensure project has proper open source licensing and legal documentation.

WHY THIS PRIORITY: Without proper licensing, the project cannot be effectively open-sourced or used by others, creating legal risk and limiting community adoption.

INDEPENDENT TEST: Review presence and completeness of required legal files (LICENSE, NOTICE, etc.) and verify they contain appropriate content.

Creates:
- NOTICE file for third-party attributions
- GOVERNANCE.md for project decision-making
- Verification of existing legal files (LICENSE, CODE_OF_CONDUCT, SECURITY, CONTRIBUTING)

title: Create NOTICE file
description:
Create NOTICE file at repository root for third-party attributions.

WHY: Transparency about third-party dependencies is best practice for open source projects, even when attribution is not legally required.

WHAT: Create NOTICE file listing all third-party dependencies with their licenses and source URLs.
design:
Create /NOTICE file with:
- Project name and copyright
- List of third-party software (Cobra, Bubble Tea, go-git, YAML v3)
- License for each (Apache 2.0, MIT)
- Source URLs

Dependencies from research.md 'Third-Party Dependencies' section.

Content template in quickstart.md Step 1.
acceptance_criteria:
- NOTICE file exists at repository root
- Lists all 4 main dependencies (Cobra, Bubble Tea, go-git, YAML v3)

- References go.mod/go.sum for full list
- Follows format from quickstart.md

- Contains all 5 required sections
- Decision-making process is clear

- Build targets: linux, darwin, windows (amd64, arm64)
- Checksum generation (checksums.txt)

Reference: plan.md Technical Context, contracts/ci-cd-contract.md

title: Test release process dry-run
description:
Test the release process using GoReleaser dry-run mode.

WHY: Validate release automation works correctly before attempting an actual release.

WHAT: Create test tag and run GoReleaser in dry-run mode to verify artifact generation.

1. Create test tag: git tag -a v0.0.0-test -m 'Test release'
2. Run: goreleaser release --clean --skip-publish --skip-sign
3. Verify artifacts in dist/
4. Clean up: git tag -d v0.0.0-test

Reference: quickstart.md 'Testing the Release Process' section
acceptance_criteria:
- Test tag created successfully
- GoReleaser dry-run completes without errors
- dist/ contains binaries for all platforms
- checksums.txt generated
- Test tag cleaned up after verification

title: CLI Authentication
description: Browser-based OAuth-style authentication for the SpecLedger CLI, enabling users to sign in via browser and automatically capture credentials. Supports CI/headless environments with direct token authentication flags.

title: Setup Phase
description: Project initialization and basic auth package structure

title: Foundational: Core Auth Infrastructure
description: Core authentication infrastructure needed by all user stories: Credentials model, storage functions, environment configuration

title: US1: Browser-Based Login
description: P1 - Users can authenticate via browser, with automatic credential capture via local callback server

title: US2: Token-Based Login (CI/Headless)
description: P2 - Users in CI/CD pipelines can authenticate with --token or --refresh flags

title: US3: Check Authentication Status
description: P2 - Users can verify authentication status and see account information

title: US4: Logout and Clear Credentials
description: P3 - Users can sign out and remove stored credentials

title: US5: Token Refresh
description: P3 - Users can manually refresh expired access tokens

title: Create pkg/cli/auth package structure
description: Initialize the auth package directory structure for authentication functionality
design: Create pkg/cli/auth/ directory with placeholder files
acceptance_criteria: pkg/cli/auth/ exists with proper Go package

title: Add auth command group to CLI
description: Register sl auth command group with Cobra CLI framework
design: Add VarAuthCmd to pkg/cli/commands/auth.go and register in main.go
acceptance_criteria: sl auth --help shows available subcommands

title: Implement Credentials struct and methods
description: Core Credentials type for storing authentication tokens and user info
design: In pkg/cli/auth/credentials.go: Credentials struct with access_token, refresh_token, expires_in, created_at, user_email, user_id. Methods: IsExpired(), ExpiresAt(), IsValid()
acceptance_criteria: Credentials struct serializes to JSON, IsExpired correctly detects expiration

title: Implement credential storage functions
description: Functions to load, save, and delete credentials from disk
design: In pkg/cli/auth/credentials.go: GetCredentialsPath() returns ~/.specledger/credentials.json, LoadCredentials() reads file, SaveCredentials() writes with 0600 perms, DeleteCredentials() removes file
acceptance_criteria: Credentials persist at ~/.specledger/credentials.json with 0600 permissions

title: Implement environment-based URL configuration
description: Support production vs development URL configuration via environment variables
design: In pkg/cli/commands/auth.go: getAuthURL() checks SPECLEDGER_AUTH_URL, SPECLEDGER_ENV env vars. In pkg/cli/auth/client.go: getAPIURL() for API endpoint configuration
acceptance_criteria: SPECLEDGER_ENV=dev uses localhost URLs, otherwise production URLs

title: Implement CallbackServer for OAuth callback
description: Local HTTP server to receive authentication tokens from browser
design: In pkg/cli/auth/server.go: CallbackServer struct with port 2026, http.Server, net.Listener, result channel. Methods: NewCallbackServer(), Port(), CallbackURL(), Start(), WaitForCallback(timeout), Shutdown(), handleCallback()
acceptance_criteria: Server starts on port 2026, receives GET/POST callbacks, supports CORS, redirects browser after callback

title: Implement cross-platform browser opening
description: Open default browser on macOS, Linux, and Windows
design: In pkg/cli/auth/browser.go: OpenBrowser(url) detects OS via runtime.GOOS, uses open (macOS), xdg-open (Linux), cmd /c start (Windows)
acceptance_criteria: Browser opens on all three major platforms

title: Implement sl auth login command
description: Main login command with browser-based authentication flow
design: In pkg/cli/commands/auth.go: runLogin() starts CallbackServer, builds auth URL with callback param, opens browser, waits for callback (5min timeout), saves credentials. Shows manual auth instructions on callback failure.
acceptance_criteria: sl auth login opens browser, captures callback, stores credentials, handles timeout gracefully

title: Implement RefreshAccessToken HTTP client
description: HTTP client to exchange refresh token for access token
design: In pkg/cli/auth/client.go: RefreshAccessToken(refreshToken) POSTs to /api/cli/refresh, parses RefreshTokenResponse, returns new Credentials
acceptance_criteria: Refresh token successfully exchanged for new access token via API

title: Add --token flag for direct access token login
description: Support authenticating with pre-obtained access token for CI/headless
design: In pkg/cli/commands/auth.go: Add --token flag to VarAuthLoginCmd, runAccessTokenLogin() saves credentials with provided token
acceptance_criteria: sl auth login --token <token> stores credentials without browser interaction

title: Create specledger.help.md command
description: Create the help command that displays all available SpecLedger commands organized by workflow stage
design: File: .claude/commands/specledger.help.md - Include sections: Core Workflow (specify, plan, tasks, implement), Analysis & Validation (audit, analyze, clarify, checklist), Setup & Configuration (constitution, help), Collaboration (revise, adopt)
acceptance_criteria: Command displays categorized list of all commands with descriptions and workflow examples

title: Create specledger.audit.md command
description: Create the two-phase codebase audit command for analyzing unfamiliar codebases
design: File: .claude/commands/specledger.audit.md - Quick phase: detect language, find entry points, identify frameworks (~15 min). Deep phase: discover modules, extract functions, build dependency graph (~30+ min). Output: scripts/audit-cache.json
acceptance_criteria: Audit detects Go language, identifies go.mod, finds main.go entry points, and generates JSON cache with modules and dependencies

title: Create specledger.revise.md command
description: Create the review comments command for fetching and addressing Supabase review comments
design: File: .claude/commands/specledger.revise.md - Fetch comments via scripts/review-comments.js by-path, display context with selected text, provide options to address feedback, mark resolved after edit
acceptance_criteria: Command fetches unresolved comments from Supabase, displays context, and allows interactive resolution

title: Add Supabase sync to specledger.implement.md
description: Update implement command to sync issues from Supabase before starting implementation
design: File: .claude/commands/specledger.implement.md - Add Step 1 to run 'node scripts/pull-issues.js' with repo owner/name extracted from git remote. Check credentials file exists, fail with login prompt if missing.
acceptance_criteria: Running /specledger.implement syncs .beads/issues.jsonl from Supabase before checking prerequisites

title: Add --from-audit mode to specledger.adopt.md
description: Update adopt command to support creating specs from cached audit data
design: File: .claude/commands/specledger.adopt.md - Add --module-id [ID] --from-audit flags. Read module data from scripts/audit-cache.json. Infer user scenarios from key functions, requirements from API contracts.
acceptance_criteria: Running /specledger.adopt --module-id [ID] --from-audit generates spec from cached audit data

title: Enhanced: Purpose Sections
description: Improve command discoverability by adding Purpose and When to use sections to all existing commands
design: Update 8 command files (.claude/commands/specledger.*.md) to include standardized Purpose and When to use sections at the top of each file
acceptance_criteria: All commands include Purpose sections that clearly explain what each command does and when to use it

title: Utility Scripts: Supabase Integration
description: Create Node.js utility scripts for Supabase integration to support issue syncing and review comment management
design: Create two scripts: scripts/pull-issues.js for syncing beads issues from Supabase to .beads/issues.jsonl, and scripts/review-comments.js with subcommands (by-path, by-project, by-change, resolve)
acceptance_criteria: Scripts successfully sync issues and manage review comments via Supabase API

title: Add Purpose sections to 8 command files
description: Add standardized Purpose and When to use sections to all existing SpecLedger commands
design: Update files: specledger.adopt.md, specledger.analyze.md, specledger.checklist.md, specledger.clarify.md, specledger.constitution.md, specledger.implement.md, specledger.plan.md, specledger.specify.md, specledger.tasks.md
acceptance_criteria: Each command file has a Purpose section explaining the command's role in the workflow

title: Create pull-issues.js utility script
description: Create Node.js script to sync beads issues from Supabase to local .beads/issues.jsonl
design: File: scripts/pull-issues.js - Use @supabase/supabase-js to fetch issues. Read credentials from ~/.specledger/credentials.json. Accept repo owner/name as arguments. Write to .beads/issues.jsonl in JSONL format.
acceptance_criteria: Running node scripts/pull-issues.js [owner] [repo] syncs all issues including dependencies and comments

title: Create review-comments.js utility script
description: Create Node.js script to query and manage review comments from Supabase
design: File: scripts/review-comments.js - Use @supabase/supabase-js. Support subcommands: by-path (filter by file), by-project (all project comments), by-change (filter by change ID), resolve (mark comment resolved). Output JSON to stdout.
acceptance_criteria: Script supports all subcommands and correctly queries/updates Supabase review comments

title: Simplify AGENTS.md documentation
description: Clean up and simplify AGENTS.md to focus on bd issue tracking workflow
design: File: AGENTS.md - Remove dependency section, simplify agent descriptions, focus on bd CLI usage for issue tracking
acceptance_criteria: AGENTS.md is concise and focused on bd-based issue tracking workflow
